verses.verse: And the Lord<WH3068> spoke<WH1696> unto Moses<WH4872> and unto Aaron<WH175>, saying<WH559>,

This is the ordinance<WH2708> of the law<WH8451> which the Lord<WH3068> has commanded<WH6680>, saying<WH559>, Speak<WH1696> unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, that they bring<WH3947> you a red<WH122> heifer<WH6510> outside spot<WH8549>, where is no blemish<WH3971>, and upon which never<WH3808> came<WH5927> yoke<WH5923>:
And you shall give<WH5414> her unto Eleazar<WH499> the priest<WH3548>, that he may bring her forth<WH3318> outside<WH2351> the camp<WH4264>, and one shall kill<WH7819> her before his face<WH6440>:

And Eleazar<WH499> the priest<WH3548> shall take<WH3947> of her blood<WH1818> with his finger<WH676>, and sprinkle<WH5137> of her blood<WH1818> directly<WH5227> before<WH6440> the tabernacle<WH168> of the congregation<WH4150> seven<WH7651> times<WH6471>:
And one shall burn<WH8313> the heifer<WH6510> in his sight<WH5869>; her skin<WH5785>, and her flesh<WH1320>, and her blood<WH1818>, with her dung<WH6569>, shall he burn<WH8313>:
And the priest<WH3548> shall take<WH3947> cedar<WH730> wood<WH6086>, and hyssop<WH231>, and scarlet<WH8438>, and cast<WH7993> it into the middle<WH8432> of the burning<WH8316> of the heifer<WH6510>.

Then the priest<WH3548> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and he shall bathe<WH7364> his flesh<WH1320> in water<WH4325>, and afterward<WH310> he shall come<WH935> into the camp<WH4264>, and the priest<WH3548> shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.
And he that burneth<WH8313> her shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899> in water<WH4325>, and bathe<WH7364> his flesh<WH1320> in water<WH4325>, and shall be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>.

And a man<WH376> that is clean<WH2889> shall gather<WH622> up the ashes<WH665> of the heifer<WH6510>, and lay them up<WH3240> outside<WH2351> the camp<WH4264> in a clean<WH2889> place<WH4725>, and it shall be kept<WH4931> for the congregation<WH5712> of the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> for a water<WH4325> of separation<WH5079>: it is a purification for sin<WH2403>.

And he that gathers<WH622> the ashes<WH665> of the heifer<WH6510> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>, and be unclean<WH2930> until the evening<WH6153>: and it shall be unto the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478>, and unto the stranger<WH1616> that stays<WH1481> among<WH8432> them<WH2708>, for a statute for ever<WH5769>.
He that touches<WH5060> the dead<WH4191> body<WH5315> of any man<WH120> shall be unclean<WH2930> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>.

He shall purify<WH2398> himself with it on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, and on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> he shall be clean<WH2891>: but if he purify<WH2398> not himself the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, then the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> he shall not be clean<WH2891>.

Whoever touches<WH5060> the dead<WH4191> body<WH5315> of any man<WH120> that is dead<WH4191>, and purifies<WH2398> not himself<WH2930>, defiles the tabernacle<WH4908> of the Lord<WH3068>; and that soul<WH5315> shall be cut off<WH3772> from Israel<WH3478>: because the water<WH4325> of separation<WH5079> was not sprinkled<WH2236> upon him<WH2931>, he shall be unclean; his uncleanness is yet upon him<WH2932>.

This is the law<WH8451>, when a man<WH120> dies<WH4191> in a tent<WH168>: all that come<WH935> into the tent<WH168>, and all that is in the tent<WH168>, shall be unclean<WH2930> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>.
And every open<WH6605> vessel<WH3627>, which has no covering<WH6781> bound<WH6616> upon it<WH2931>, is unclean.

And whoever touches<WH5060> one that is slain<WH2491> with a sword<WH2719> in the open<WH6440> fields<WH7704>, or a dead body<WH4191>, or a bone<WH6106> of a man<WH120>, or a engrave<WH6913>, shall be unclean<WH2930> seven<WH7651> days<WH3117>.

And for an unclean<WH2931> person they shall take<WH3947> of the ashes<WH6083> of the burnt heifer<WH8316> of purification for sin<WH2403>, and running<WH2416> water<WH4325> shall be put<WH5414> thereto in a vessel<WH3627>:

And a clean<WH2889> person<WH376> shall take<WH3947> hyssop<WH231>, and dip<WH2881> it in the water<WH4325>, and sprinkle<WH5137> it upon the tent<WH168>, and upon all the vessels<WH3627>, and upon the persons<WH5315> that were there<WH5060>, and upon him that touched a bone<WH6106>, or one slain<WH2491>, or one dead<WH4191>, or a grave<WH6913>:

And the clean<WH2889> person shall sprinkle<WH5137> upon the unclean<WH2931> on the third<WH7992> day<WH3117>, and on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117>: and on the seventh<WH7637> day<WH3117> he shall purify<WH2398> himself<WH3526>, and wash his clothes<WH899>, and bathe<WH7364> himself in water<WH4325>, and shall be clean<WH2891> at evening<WH6153>.

But the man<WH376> that shall be unclean<WH2930>, and shall not purify<WH2398> himself<WH5315>, that soul shall be cut off<WH3772> from among<WH8432> the congregation<WH6951>, because he has defiled<WH2930> the sanctuary<WH4720> of the Lord<WH3068>: the water<WH4325> of separation<WH5079> has not been sprinkled<WH2236> upon him<WH2931>; he is unclean.

And it shall be a perpetual<WH5769> statute<WH2708> unto them<WH5137>, that he that sprinkles the water<WH4325> of separation<WH5079> shall wash<WH3526> his clothes<WH899>; and he that touches<WH5060> the water<WH4325> of separation<WH5079> shall be unclean<WH2930> until evening<WH6153>.
And whatever the unclean<WH2931> person touches<WH5060> shall be unclean<WH2930>; and the soul<WH5315> that touches<WH5060> it shall be unclean<WH2930> until evening<WH6153>.
